gurmukhi: jwhu khXo qum Dwmn kO bqIXw sun moh pRjw biRj BInI ] nMd khXo biRj kI ibn kwnH BeI su purI sB hInI ]857]
transliteration: Jaah(u) Kahyo Toum Dhaamanndkau Bateeyaa Soun Moh Prajaa Brij Bheenee|| Nand Kahyo Brij Kikaahn Bhaisu Purisabh Heenee||857||
translation: Then Nand asked all the people present there to go to their homes; this was what Nand said, but without Krishna the land of Braja would lose all its glory.857.

gurmukhi: sIs Jukwie gXo biRj ko Aiq hI mn BIqr Sok BXo hY ] ijau koaU qwq mry pCuqwq hY pXwry koaU mno BRwq CXo hY ]
transliteration: Sees Jhoukaae Gado Brij Ko At(i) Himan Bheetar Shok Bhayo Hai|| Jio Ko( i)  Taat Dare Pachoutaat Hai Pydare Ko( i)  Mano Bhraat Chhayo Hai||
translation: Bowing his head, Nand also left for Braja, with extreme sorrow in his mind; all of them are in great anguish like the bereavement on the death of the father or brother;

gurmukhi: pY ijmrwj bfy irprwj kI pYrn mY piq Koie gXo hY ] XoN aupjI aupmw bsudy Tg sXwm mno Dn lUt lXo hY ]858]
transliteration: Pai Jimraaj Bade Ripraaj Kipairan Mai Pat(i) Khoe Gado Hai|| Yon Oupjioupmaa Basude Thag Syaam Mano Dhan Loot Layo||858||
translation: Or like the seizure of the kingdom and honour of a great sovereign by an enemy; the poet says that it appears to him that a thug like Vasudev has plundered the wealth of Krishna.858.

gurmukhi: nMd bwc pur dwn jn so ]
transliteration: Nand Baach Pur Daan Pur Daan Jan So||
translation: Speech of Nand addressed to the residents of the city:

gurmukhi: nMd Awie biRj pur ibKY khI kiRSn kI bwq ] sunq Sok kIno sBY rodn kIno mwq ]859]
transliteration: Nand Aae Brij Pur Bikhai Kahikrishan Kibaat|| Sounat Shok Keeno Sabhai Rodan Keeno Maat||859||
translation: On coming to Braja, Nand told all the matter regarding Krishna, hearing which all were filled with anguish and Yashoda also began to weep.859.

gurmukhi: bcXo ijn qwq bfy Aih qy ijnhU bk bIr blI hin d`eIXw ] jwih mrXo AG nwm mhw irpu pY ipArvw muslIDr B`eIXw ]
transliteration: Badhyo Jin Taat Bade Ah(i) Te Jinhoo Bak Beer Balihan(i) Daeeyaa|| Jaah(i) Daryo Agh Naam Mahaa Rip(u) Pai Piarvaa Mousleedhar Bhaeeeeyaa||
translation: He, who saved his father from the enormous snake; he, who killed the powerful demon Bakasura; he, the brother of dear Haldhar (Balram) who killed the demon named Aghasura;

gurmukhi: jo qpsXw kir kY pRB ky kib sXwm khY pr pwien l`eIXw ] so pur bwsn CIn lXo hm qy sunIXo sKI pUq knReIXw ]860]
transliteration: Jo Tapasyaa Kar(i) Kai Prabh Ke Kabi Syaam Kahai Par Paain Laeeeeyaa|| So Pur Baasan Chheen Layo Ham Te Souneeye Sakhipoot Kanhaeeyaa||860||
translation: And he, whose feet can be realised by meditating on the Lord, O friend! that Lord Krishna of mine has been snatched away from me by the residents of Mathura.860.

gurmukhi: suin kY ieh bwq sBY imil gÍwrn pY imil kY iqn Sok su kIno ] AwnMd dUir krXo mn qy hir DXwn ibKY iqnhU mn dIno ]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Eh Baat Sabhai Mil(i) Gvaaran Pai Mil(i) Kai Tin Shok Su Keeno|| Oonand Door(i) Daryo Man Te Har(i) Dhyaan Bikhai Tinhoo Man Deeno||
translation: Hearing these words all the gopis were filled with sorrow; the bliss of their mind had ended and all of them meditated on Krishna;
